DataElement.preferredName: Analysis of Variance Programming Parameter False_Discovery_Rate Computation Method FalseDiscoveryRateControl
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A statistical technique which helps in making inference whether three or more samples might come from populations having the same mean; specifically, whether the differences among the samples might be caused by chance variation.:A value that is passed to a routine._NCI|A statistical method used for multiple testing corrections to control the expected proportion of false positives (Type I error) among rejected tests or hypotheses.:The act of calculating; determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal._Use which method to do False Discovery Rate Control

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Analysis of Variance Programming Parameter False_Discovery_Rate Computation Method
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A statistical technique which helps in making inference whether three or more samples might come from populations having the same mean; specifically, whether the differences among the samples might be caused by chance variation.:A value that is passed to a routine._NCI|A statistical method used for multiple testing corrections to control the expected proportion of false positives (Type I error) among rejected tests or hypotheses.:The act of calculating; determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A statistical technique which helps in making inference whether three or more samples might come from populations having the same mean; specifically, whether the differences among the samples might be caused by chance variation.:A value that is passed to a routine.

Concepts.definition: A statistical technique which helps in making inference whether three or more samples might come from populations having the same mean; specifically, whether the differences among the samples might be caused by chance variation.
A value that is passed to a routine.

Property.preferredDefinition: NCI|A statistical method used for multiple testing corrections to control the expected proportion of false positives (Type I error) among rejected tests or hypotheses.:The act of calculating; determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: A statistical method used for multiple testing corrections to control the expected proportion of false positives (Type I error) among rejected tests or hypotheses.  It is less stringent than other multiple testing corrections and thereby, will allow a percentage of false positives.
The act of calculating; determining something by mathematical or logical methods.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released workflow status per 7/13/09 request of VCDE following successful Silver Compatibility review.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Use which method to do False Discovery Rate Control

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates the probability of rejecting the statistical hypothesis tested when in fact, that hypothesis is true.

Concepts.definition: Indicates the probability of rejecting the statistical hypothesis tested when in fact, that hypothesis is true.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Used in multiple comparison procedures to calculate an adjusted probability, alpha (a), of comparison-wise type I error from the desired probability aFW0 of family-wise type I error. The calculation guarantees that the use of the adjusted a in pairwise comparisons keeps the actual probability aFW of family-wise type I errors not higher than the desired level, as specified by aFW0.

Concepts.definition: Used in multiple comparison procedures to calculate an adjusted probability, alpha (a), of comparison-wise type I error from the desired probability aFW0 of family-wise type I error. The calculation guarantees that the use of the adjusted a in pairwise comparisons keeps the actual probability aFW of family-wise type I errors not higher than the desired level, as specified by aFW0.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A multiple comparison adjustment method where the p-values are ranked in descending order. For the highest p-value, the critical p-value becomes (alpha/n), where n is the number of outcomes being tested; for the second-highest p-value, the critical p-value will be (alpha/n-1), and so on. The stringency of this correction falls somewhere between no correction and the Standard Bonferroni.

Concepts.definition: A multiple comparison adjustment method where the p-values are ranked in descending order. For the highest p-value, the critical p-value becomes (alpha/n), where n is the number of outcomes being tested; for the second-highest p-value, the critical p-value will be (alpha/n-1), and so on. The stringency of this correction falls somewhere between no correction and the Standard Bonferroni.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An adjustment method used in multiple comparison procedures to calculate an adjusted probability. This method ranks probabilities in descending order of their absolute p-values first, then calculate the adjusted p-values by an algorithm described in Dudoit et al. 2003.

Concepts.definition: An adjustment method used in multiple comparison procedures to calculate an adjusted probability. This method ranks probabilities in descending order of their absolute p-values first, then calculate the adjusted p-values by an algorithm described in Dudoit et al. 2003.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A part, fraction, share, or number considered in relation to the whole amount or number.

Concepts.definition: A part, fraction, share, or number considered in relation to the whole amount or number.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
